identificationModule.briefTitle: APPRAISE 2.0: Live Trial of the APPRAISE Trauma Decision Support System
identificationModule.officialTitle: APPRAISE 2.0: Live Trial of the APPRAISE Trauma Decision Support System

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: Principal Investigator; Associate Prof. of Emergency Medicine

armGroups.label: APPRAISE cases
armGroups.description: Trauma patients for which APPRAISE system was used
interventionNames: Device: APPRAISE Trauma Clinical Decision Support System

interventions.name: APPRAISE Trauma Clinical Decision Support System
interventions.description: Real-time bedside decision-support system for trauma patient management

primaryOutcomes.measure: Software session with error messages or critical software errors
primaryOutcomes.description: Each time the software is used ("session"), a log file is generated. We will quantify how many sessions generate error messages or critical software errors.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From patient arrival in the Emergency Department through enrollment, protocol initiation, and protocol completion (which is typically 30 min after protocol initiation).

primaryOutcomes.measure: Clinician surveys that the software negatively affected patient care
primaryOutcomes.description: Each time the software is used, clinicians are surveyed whether the software negatively affected patient care, in their professional judgement
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From patient arrival in the Emergency Department through enrollment, protocol initiation, and protocol completion (which is typically 30 min after protocol initiation)

primaryOutcomes.measure: Clinician surveys that the software positively affected patient care
primaryOutcomes.description: Each time the software is used, clinicians are surveyed whether the software negatively affected patient care, in their professional judgement
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From patient arrival in the Emergency Department through enrollment, protocol initiation, and protocol completion (which is typically 30 min after protocol initiation)

primaryOutcomes.measure: Clinician surveys that ongoing use of the software poses risks that exceeds benefits
primaryOutcomes.description: Each time the software is used, clinicians are surveyed whether ongoing use of the software poses risks that exceeds benefits
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From patient arrival in the Emergency Department through enrollment, protocol initiation, and protocol completion (which is typically 30 min after protocol initiation)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Adult (≥18 yrs) Emergency Department (ED) patient
* Triaged to the "Acute" area of the ED. (The "Acute" area is the designated area for ED patients with potential or established critical illness. Triage to Acute is a routine ED operation that is performed based on departmental guidelines and the professional judgement of an experienced triage nurse).
* Clinical concern for acute injury (based on either an explicitly chief complaint of acute injury, or clinical team with documented concern for acute injury as a relevant part of patient presentation).

Exclusion Criteria:

* Prisoners
* Patients known to be pregnant, based on patient report, physical exam, or bedside ultrasound
* Patients wearing an "EFIC Opt-Out" bracelet
* Any concern about the suitability of the software system for a specific patient by any clinician involved in the patient's ED care, or by the patient themselves (or by any LAR \[lawfully authorized representative\] of the patient).
